thread.title: Could Coronation Street legend Ken Barlow be about to say farewell to Weatherfield?
thread.title_full: Could Coronation Street legend Ken Barlow be about to say farewell to Weatherfield?

author: ekirby
title: Could Coronation Street legend Ken Barlow be about to say farewell to Weatherfield?
text:
'hanging by a thread' Could Coronation Street legend Ken Barlow be about to say farewell to Weatherfield? 
Soap veteran set for hospital dash after being struck down by suspected stroke to leave viewers fretting over a ‘will he survive’ cliffhanger. Exclusive by laura armstrong, sunday showbiz editor 5th February 2017, 12:04 am Comments CORRIE’S Ken Barlow has survived falling down a ravine, an armed siege and an overdose attempt. 
Now it looks like he could finally be on his way out — thanks to a suspected stroke. TV3 Images 5 Corrie legend Ken Barlow will be left fighting for his life after he is found unconscious – less than six months after suffering a stroke 
The soap veteran – played by Bill Roache – will be rushed to hospital in the coming weeks after he is struck down by a suspected second attack in a ‘will he survive’ cliffhanger. 
And show insiders told how the character’s life will be “hanging by a thread” with the drama sending shockwaves through Weatherfield. 
“He is rushed to hospital and his life is very much hanging in the balance. 
“Obviously for someone who was so recently ill, the chances of him coming out of it alive – let alone unscathed – are drastically reduced. 
“That isn’t lost on any of Weatherfield’s residents – who are all in uproar after the news of his sudden predicament becomes known. Rex Features Ken has so far survived falling down a ravine, an armed siege and an overdose attempt Related Stories Corrie's Michelle Connor to embark on new romance with Robert Preston afterSteve McDonald marriage crumbles #DirkNotKirk Corrie fans launch hilarious campaign to prove these characters should NOT be confused with each other COBBLES SHOCK Coronation Street's Leanne Battersby disgusted as she uncovers ex Peter Barlow's affair with her sister Toyah SOAP SHOCKERS 7 biggest soap blunders from Coronation Street, EastEnders and Emmerdale WALL OF SMUT Corrie's saucy secrets revealed as pics from the old set reveal the cast cut out innuendos from scripts and stuck them on 'wall of shame' WHERE'S THE WINE? Corrie fans left puzzled as Kate Connor serves heartbroken Toyah Battersby an empty bottle of wine News Group Newspapers Ltd The soap veteran – played by Bill Roache – will be rushed to hospital in the coming weeks after he is struck down by a suspected second attack 
“They are all discussing how he could possibly survive a second stroke in six months. 
“And as he is a very much loved character, the bosses are expecting viewers to be gripped as well. 
“Ken has been through a lot in his time on Corrie , but the big question is whether or not he can survive something as serious as this.” 
Viewers were shocked last year when Ken – who is the soap’s only original character – suffered a stroke during a heart-breaking episode. 
After regaining consciousness he showed reduced speech abilities and spent weeks in hospital, but later seemed to make a full recovery. News Group Newspapers Ltd 5 Show insiders told how the character’s life will be ‘hanging by a thread’ with the drama sending shockwaves through Weatherfield 
He said: “It made me feel paranoid about my job. The first thing I said (when I was told about the stroke storyline) was: ‘Do I get better?’ 
A Corrie spokeswoman said: “We don’t comment on storylines.”
